docs.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Plugin Marketplace
docs.text: Welcome to the official plugin marketplace for automating F5 Distributed Cloud (XC) operations with Claude Code.

docs.title: What is this Marketplace?
docs.text:
This marketplace provides a curated collection of Claude Code plugins designed specifically for network engineers, DevOps teams, and platform engineers working with F5 Distributed Cloud.

Quick Start

# Add this marketplace to Claude Code
/plugin marketplace add robinmordasiewicz/f5-distributed-cloud-marketplace

# Install a plugin
/plugin install f5xc-chrome

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Automation First

    Automate repetitive F5 XC console tasks with intelligent browser automation and API integration.

  • Modular Design

    Install only the plugins you need. Each plugin is independently versioned and maintained.

  • Enterprise Ready

    Built with security in mind, supporting Azure AD SSO and enterprise authentication flows.

  • Open Source

    MIT licensed and community-driven. Contributions welcome!

docs.title: Available Plugins
docs.text: Plugin Description Status f5xc-chrome Browser automation for F5 XC console  Available f5xc-cli CLI operations and scripting  Planned f5xc-terraform Infrastructure as Code integration  Planned f5xc-docs Documentation and API lookup  Planned

docs.title: Streamlined Workflow
docs.text:
Instead of manually navigating the F5 XC console, use natural language commands to:

  • Create and configure HTTP load balancers
  • Manage origin pools and health checks
  • Deploy WAF policies
  • Navigate complex multi-tenant environments

docs.title: AI-Powered Assistance
docs.text:
Claude Code understands your intent and translates it into precise console actions:

You: "Create an HTTP load balancer for my API with WAF protection"
Claude: Navigates to the correct namespace, creates the LB, configures origins,
        attaches WAF policy, and validates the configuration.

docs.title: Consistent Operations
docs.text: Reduce human error with repeatable, auditable automation sequences that follow best practices.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before using plugins from this marketplace:

  1. Claude Code - Install Claude Code
  2. Claude in Chrome Extension - Required for browser automation plugins

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
• Getting Started Guide
  • Troubleshooting
  • GitHub Issues

docs.title: License
docs.text: This marketplace and its plugins are released under the MIT License.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: We welcome contributions to the F5 Distributed Cloud plugin marketplace! This guide explains how to add plugins, improve existing ones, or enhance the marketplace.

docs.title: 1. Add a New Plugin
docs.text: Create and publish your own F5 XC automation plugin.

docs.title: 2. Improve Existing Plugins
docs.text: Submit bug fixes, features, or documentation improvements.

docs.title: 3. Enhance the Marketplace
docs.text: Improve validation, automation, or documentation.

docs.title: Adding a Plugin to the Marketplace
Step 1: Create Your Plugin
docs.text:
Your plugin repository must have a valid .claude-plugin/plugin.json:

{
  "name": "your-plugin-name",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "What your plugin does",
  "author": {
    "name": "Your Name",
    "email": "you@example.com",
    "url": "https://github.com/yourusername"
  },
  "license": "MIT",
  "keywords": ["f5", "xc", "your-tags"],
  "commands": "./commands/",
  "skills": "./skills/"
}

docs.title: Step 2: Fork the Marketplace
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/robinmordasiewicz/f5-distributed-cloud-marketplace
cd f5-distributed-cloud-marketplace

docs.title: Step 3: Add Your Plugin Entry
docs.text:
Edit .claude-plugin/marketplace.json:

{
  "plugins": [
    {
      "name": "your-plugin-name",
      "description": "What your plugin does",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "author": {
        "name": "Your Name",
        "url": "https://github.com/yourusername"
      },
      "source": {
        "source": "github",
        "repo": "yourusername/your-plugin-repo"
      },
      "category": "automation",
      "tags": ["f5", "xc", "your-tags"]
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Step 4: Submit a Pull Request
docs.text:
1. Create a feature branch
  2. Commit your changes
  3. Push to your fork
  4. Open a Pull Request

docs.title: Required Files
docs.text: File Description .claude-plugin/plugin.json Plugin manifest with metadata README.md Plugin documentation LICENSE Open source license

docs.title: Recommended Structure
docs.text:
your-plugin/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── plugin.json
├── commands/
│   └── your-command.md
├── skills/
│   └── your-skill/
│       └── SKILL.md
├── README.md
├── LICENSE
└── CHANGELOG.md

docs.title: Quality Standards
docs.text:
• Plugin installs without errors
  • Commands work as documented
  • Source repository is publicly accessible
  • License is clearly specified
  • Documentation is clear and complete

docs.title: Commit Convention
docs.text:
This project uses Conventional Commits:

Type Description Version Bump feat: New features Minor fix: Bug fixes Patch docs: Documentation None chore: Maintenance None refactor: Code restructuring None test: Testing None

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# New feature
git commit -m "feat: add support for origin pool creation"

# Bug fix
git commit -m "fix: resolve authentication timeout issue"

# Documentation
git commit -m "docs: update installation instructions"

# Breaking change
git commit -m "feat!: redesign command interface"

docs.title: Clone the Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/robinmordasiewicz/f5-distributed-cloud-marketplace
cd f5-distributed-cloud-marketplace

docs.title: Install Dependencies
docs.text:
For documentation development:

pip install mkdocs-material mkdocs-minify-plugin

docs.title: Local Documentation Preview
docs.text:
# Generate plugin docs
python scripts/generate-plugin-docs.py

# Serve locally
mkdocs serve

Visit http://localhost:8000 to preview.

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
Before submitting, ensure your changes pass validation:

# Validate marketplace.json syntax
python -m json.tool .claude-plugin/marketplace.json

# Check plugin sources are accessible
python scripts/generate-plugin-docs.py

docs.title: Code of Conduct
docs.text:
• Be respectful and inclusive
  • Provide constructive feedback
  • Help others learn and grow
  • Focus on the technical merits

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
• Open an Issue
  • Start a Discussion

docs.title: License
docs.text: By contributing, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under the MIT License.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide walks you through installing and using plugins from the F5 Distributed Cloud marketplace.

docs.title: 1. Install Claude Code
docs.text:
Claude Code is Anthropic's official CLI for AI-powered software engineering.

# Install Claude Code
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code

Or visit claude.com/claude-code for installation instructions.

docs.title: 2. Install Claude in Chrome Extension
docs.text:
For browser automation plugins (like f5xc-chrome), you need the Claude in Chrome extension:

  1. Open Chrome Web Store
  2. Search for "Claude in Chrome"
  3. Click "Add to Chrome"
  4. Grant necessary permissions

docs.title: Adding the Marketplace
docs.text:
Add this marketplace to your Claude Code installation:

InteractiveCLI 
/plugin marketplace add robinmordasiewicz/f5-distributed-cloud-marketplace

claude plugin marketplace add robinmordasiewicz/f5-distributed-cloud-marketplace

Verify the marketplace is added:

/plugin marketplace list

docs.title: Browse Available Plugins
docs.text:
/plugin

This shows all plugins from configured marketplaces.

docs.title: Install a Specific Plugin
docs.text:
From MarketplaceDirect from GitHub 
/plugin install f5xc-chrome

/plugin install robinmordasiewicz/f5xc-chrome

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text: /plugin list

docs.title: f5xc-chrome Plugin
docs.text: The f5xc-chrome plugin provides browser automation for the F5 XC console.

docs.title: Login to F5 XC Console
docs.text:
/xc:console login https://your-tenant.console.ves.volterra.io

This initiates Azure SSO authentication and logs you into the console.

docs.title: Navigate to a Workspace
docs.text: /xc:console nav "Web App & API Protection"

docs.title: Crawl Navigation Metadata
docs.text:
/xc:console crawl https://your-tenant.console.ves.volterra.io

Extracts navigation structure for intelligent command routing.

docs.title: Create Resources
docs.text:
/xc:console create http-lb

Guides you through creating an HTTP Load Balancer.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
Credential Security

Never hardcode credentials in scripts. Use Azure AD SSO for authentication.

docs.title: Session Management
docs.text:
The browser automation maintains session state. For long-running operations:

  1. Verify you're logged in before starting
  2. Handle session timeouts gracefully
  3. Use /xc:console login to re-authenticate if needed

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
If a command fails:

  1. Check the browser console for errors
  2. Verify network connectivity
  3. Ensure you have proper permissions in F5 XC

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Explore Plugin Documentation
  • Check the Roadmap for upcoming features
  • Learn how to Contribute

docs.title: Roadmap
docs.text: This roadmap outlines the planned development of F5 Distributed Cloud plugins. Priorities may shift based on community feedback and contributions.

docs.title: Available Now
docs.text: Plugin Version Description f5xc-chrome 0.1.0 Browser automation for F5 XC console

docs.title: f5xc-cli
docs.text:
Command-line interface plugin for scripted operations.

Planned Features:

  • Resource listing and querying
  • Configuration export/import
  • Batch operations
  • Output formatting (JSON, YAML, table)

Use Cases:

# List all HTTP load balancers
/xc:cli list http-lb --namespace production

# Export configuration
/xc:cli export http-lb my-lb --format yaml

docs.title: f5xc-terraform
docs.text:
Infrastructure as Code integration with Terraform.

Planned Features:

  • Terraform resource generation
  • State file integration
  • Drift detection
  • Module templates

Use Cases:

# Generate Terraform for existing resources
/xc:tf generate http-lb my-lb

# Validate Terraform configuration
/xc:tf validate ./infrastructure/

docs.title: f5xc-docs
docs.text:
Documentation and API reference lookup.

Planned Features:

  • Inline documentation lookup
  • API reference integration
  • Example code generation
  • Best practices suggestions

Use Cases:

# Lookup documentation
/xc:docs http-lb configuration

# Get API examples
/xc:docs api origin-pool create

docs.title: f5xc-api
docs.text:
Direct API access for advanced automation.

Planned Features:

  • REST API client
  • GraphQL support
  • Token management
  • Rate limiting

Use Cases:

# Direct API call
/xc:api GET /config/namespaces

# Create via API
/xc:api POST /config/http_loadbalancers --data @config.json

docs.title: f5xc-monitor
docs.text:
Monitoring and alerting integration.

  • Performance metrics collection
  • Alert threshold configuration
  • Dashboard generation

docs.title: f5xc-security
docs.text:
Security assessment and hardening.

  • WAF policy analysis
  • Security posture assessment
  • Compliance checking

docs.title: f5xc-migrate
docs.text:
Migration tooling for onboarding.

  • Configuration import from other platforms
  • DNS migration assistance
  • Traffic cutover planning

docs.title: Feature Requests
docs.text:
Have an idea for a new plugin or feature? We'd love to hear it!

  1. Check existing issues for similar requests
  2. Open a new issue with your proposal
  3. Include use cases and expected behavior

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Want to help build these plugins? See our Contributing Guide to get started.

docs.title: Version History
docs.text: See the Changelog for detailed release notes.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Common issues and solutions for the F5 Distributed Cloud plugin marketplace.

docs.title: Marketplace Not Found
docs.text:
Symptom: Error when trying to install plugins from the marketplace.

Solution:

# Verify the marketplace is added
/plugin marketplace list

# Re-add if necessary
/plugin marketplace remove f5-distributed-cloud
/plugin marketplace add robinmordasiewicz/f5-distributed-cloud-marketplace

docs.title: Plugin Installation Fails
docs.text:
Symptom: Error during plugin installation.

Possible Causes:

  1. Network connectivity issues
  2. Plugin repository not accessible
  3. Outdated Claude Code version

Solutions:

Check NetworkDirect InstallUpdate Claude Code 
# Verify you can reach GitHub
curl -I https://github.com/robinmordasiewicz/f5xc-chrome

# Try direct installation instead of marketplace
/plugin install robinmordasiewicz/f5xc-chrome

npm update -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code

docs.title: Commands Not Appearing
docs.text:
Symptom: Plugin installed but commands not available.

Solution:

  1. Restart Claude Code after plugin installation
  2. Verify plugin is enabled:
/plugin list

docs.title: Chrome Extension Not Connected
docs.text:
Symptom: Browser commands fail with connection errors.

Solutions:

  1. Ensure Claude in Chrome extension is installed
  2. Check extension is enabled in Chrome
  3. Verify MCP connection in Claude Code settings

docs.title: Login Timeout
docs.text:
Symptom: /xc:console login times out before completing authentication.

Possible Causes:

  • Slow network connection
  • Azure AD authentication delays
  • Browser popup blocked

Solutions:

  1. Increase timeout in plugin settings
  2. Check for blocked popups in Chrome
  3. Manually complete authentication if needed

docs.title: Navigation Fails
docs.text:
Symptom: /xc:console nav cannot find the target page.

Solutions:

  1. Run crawl to update navigation metadata:
/xc:console crawl https://your-tenant.console.ves.volterra.io
  1. Verify you're logged into the correct tenant
  2. Check that the target exists in your namespace

docs.title: Session Expired
docs.text:
Symptom: Commands fail after period of inactivity.

Solution:

Re-authenticate:

/xc:console login https://your-tenant.console.ves.volterra.io

docs.title: Wrong Tenant
docs.text:
Symptom: Commands affect unexpected resources.

Solution:

  1. Verify current session:
/xc:console status
  1. Login to correct tenant:
/xc:console login https://correct-tenant.console.ves.volterra.io

docs.title: Namespace Mismatch
docs.text:
Symptom: Resources not found or created in wrong namespace.

Solution:

Navigate to correct namespace before creating resources:

/xc:console nav namespace my-namespace

docs.title: Slow Command Execution
docs.text:
Symptom: Commands take longer than expected.

Possible Causes:

  • Large DOM in console
  • Network latency
  • Complex page rendering

Solutions:

  1. Wait for page to fully load
  2. Reduce concurrent operations
  3. Use CLI plugin for batch operations (when available)

docs.title: Memory Usage
docs.text:
Symptom: Browser becomes unresponsive.

Solutions:

  1. Close unnecessary browser tabs
  2. Restart Chrome periodically during long sessions
  3. Monitor Chrome memory in Task Manager

docs.title: Gather Diagnostic Information
docs.text:
When reporting issues, include:

  1. Claude Code Version:
claude --version
  1. Plugin Version:
/plugin list

  1. Chrome Version: Check chrome://version

  2. Error Messages: Full error text or screenshot

  3. Steps to Reproduce: What commands led to the issue

docs.title: Report an Issue
docs.text:
1. Search existing issues
  2. If not found, create a new issue
  3. Use the bug report template
  4. Include diagnostic information

docs.title: Community Support
docs.text:
• GitHub Discussions (coming soon)
  • Stack Overflow tag: f5-distributed-cloud

docs.title: FAQ
docs.text:
Can I use this with multiple F5 XC tenants?

Yes, you can switch between tenants by logging in to different URLs: 

/xc:console login https://tenant1.console.ves.volterra.io
# ... work on tenant 1 ...
/xc:console login https://tenant2.console.ves.volterra.io
# ... work on tenant 2 ...

Are my credentials stored?

No credentials are stored by the plugins. Authentication is handled through Azure AD SSO with session cookies managed by Chrome.

Can I automate without browser?

The f5xc-cli and f5xc-api plugins (planned) will provide headless automation. See the Roadmap for availability.

How do I update plugins? 

/plugin update f5xc-chrome
Or reinstall to get the latest version.
